meanings.definition: The quality or state of being musical.
meanings.sent1: Her musicality shone through as she effortlessly played the piano.
meanings.sent2: His natural musicality made him a great candidate for the school choir.
meanings.sent3: The cat's musicality was evident as it meowed along with the song on the radio.
meanings.sent4: The musicality of the wind through the trees created a soothing symphony in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The musicality of the waves crashing against the shore was both calming and invigorating.

meanings.definition: The ability to perceive or create music.
meanings.sent1: His musicality allowed him to effortlessly pick up new tunes on the guitar.
meanings.sent2: She lacked musicality, so she struggled to stay on beat during the dance routine.
meanings.sent3: The robot's musicality was impressive as it flawlessly played the piano.
meanings.sent4: The musicality of the birds chirping in harmony was a delight to the ears.
meanings.sent5: The musicality of the raindrops hitting the roof created a beautiful rhythm in the room.
